intro: Hieracium macrocomum, commonly known as the large-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant is known for its ability to spread aggressively through rhizomes. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies.
